result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad Elliot Ritz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, DNA fees (if not previously done so, as to the DNA fees) up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance due prior to the end of the Extended supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.

Concurrent with: Concurrent to any other sentence.  
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Programs only after serving five (5) years of Initial Confinement on this case.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain GED/HSED.  Maintain full time/part time employment and/or schooling.
Mental health assessment and treatment.  Take all prescribed medications.

No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealings.
No contact with the victim Parminder K. and Sam's Food Store located at 1901 W. Atkinson Avenue, City and County of Milwaukee, State of WI.
Participate in a Cognitive Thinking Program and any other programming deemed appropriate by the department and/or agent.
AODA assessment and treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens with no positive results.

supervisions.notes:
If not previously done so, defendant is required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.
As a convicted felon:  defendant shall never be in possession of any firearms or weapons at any time in the future; defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad Elliot Ritz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

COURT SENTENCED Defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS, to run concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 89 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 6 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.  

Defendant IS ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration AND The Wisconsin Substance Abuse Programs ONLY after serving 5 Years of Initial Confinement on this case.

CONDITIONS AS TO EXTENDED SUPERVISION ARE AS FOLLOWS:
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, DNA fees (if not previously done so, as to the DNA fees) up to 25% of prison funds with the balance due prior to the end of the Extended Supervision.  Failure top pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Maintain full time / part time employment and or schooling.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment and treatment.
*  Random urine screens with no positive results.  No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealings.
*  Obtain GED/HSED.
*  Mental Health assessment and treatment.
*  Take all prescribed medications.
*  No contact with the victim Parminder K. and Sam's Food Store located at 1901 W. Atkinson Avenue, City and County of Mileaukee, State of Wisconsin.
*  If not previously done so, Defendant is required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.
*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons at any time in the future.
*  Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.
*  Participate in a Cognitive Thinking Program, and any other programming deemed appropriate by the Department and or agent.

Received and filed with court:
*  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief 
*  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Chad Elliot Ritz in court with attorney Curt Rogers.  Defendant Chad Elliot Ritz in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found Defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.
FILED, ORDER TO PRODUCE PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING ON APRIL 27, 2015 @1:30PM

Attorney Curt Rogers in court, defendant Chad Elliot Ritz not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-27-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Curt Rogers in court, Defendant Chad Elliot Ritz not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for James C. Griffin for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced from the Criminal Justice Facility for purposes of this hearing.     COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.  Defendant will not be produced for purposes of the next hearing.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Certification of filing of transcript. Original transcript (10 pages) commencing PRELIMINARY HEARING 02/09/2015. Received and filed. Copy of transcript forwarded to Curt Rogers, 5840 N. River Forest Dr., Glendale, WI 53209.

Defendant Chad Elliot Ritz in court with attorney Curt Rogers.  Defendant Chad Elliot Ritz in custody.  Ron Dague for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Sara Polka-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SAMS FOOD STORE, 1901 W ATKINSON, MILWAUKEE, WI.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Chad Elliot Ritz in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Chad Elliot Ritz in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge POCAN, Branch 26.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
